properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 5 at 8:34AM PST until January 6 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...IMPACTFUL SNOW BEGINNING THIS AFTERNOON AND CONTINUING THROUGH
MONDAY...

.Pacific moisture will overspread the Cascade Crest beginning
this afternoon. Several inches of snow will fall on Snoqualmie
and White Passes late tonight and through tomorrow. Snow
accumulations will be in feet on area mountains. Multiple rounds
of snow for the Blue Mountains starting this evening and
continuing through tomorrow where 3 to 9 inches are expected.
Breezy winds could lead to areas of blowing snow.

* WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 3 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Areas of
blowing snow possible.

* WHERE...In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains. In Oregon,
Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...From 4 AM to 7 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 7 PM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET
